extendedIngredients.name: hot sauce
extendedIngredients.original: 1/2 teaspoon hot sauce such as Tabasco

extendedIngredients.name: trout fillets
extendedIngredients.original: 1 lb smoked trout fillets, skin discarded and any silver skin scraped off

title: Smoked-Trout Spread
summary: Smoked-Trout Spread might be just the condiment you are searching for. This recipe serves 4. One portion of this dish contains approximately 25g of protein, 57g of fat, and a total of 657 calories. For $3.44 per serving, this recipe covers 22% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. 1 person has tried and liked this recipe. If you have trout fillets, accompaniment: whole-grain crackers, hot sauce such as tabasco, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. It is a good option if you're following a pescatarian diet. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 5 hours. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 54%. This score is solid. Try Smoked Trout Spread, Smoked Trout Spread, and Smoked Trout Spread for similar recipes.
instructions: Preparation                                                        Flake trout and transfer 2 cups to a food processor, then blend with butter, shallot, dill, lemon juice, hot sauce, and pepper until smooth. Reserve remaining trout.                                                                With motor running, add water to trout purée in a slow stream and process until water is absorbed, about 1 minute. Transfer to a bowl and fold in reserved trout, then pack mixture into a 4-cup glass or ceramic mold or bowl. Cover surface with wax paper, then tightly cover with plastic wrap and chill at least 6 hours to allow flavors to develop. Bring spread to room temperature before serving. (This will take 1 to 2 hours.)                                                Cooks' note:            Spread can be chilled up to 5 days.

steps.step: Flake trout and transfer 2 cups to a food processor, then blend with butter, shallot, dill, lemon juice, hot sauce, and pepper until smooth. Reserve remaining trout.
With motor running, add water to trout purée in a slow stream and process until water is absorbed, about 1 minute.

Transfer to a bowl and fold in reserved trout, then pack mixture into a 4-cup glass or ceramic mold or bowl. Cover surface with wax paper, then tightly cover with plastic wrap and chill at least 6 hours to allow flavors to develop. Bring spread to room temperature before serving. (This will take 1 to 2 hours.)
Spread can be chilled up to 5 days.
